abstract: Waldorf School of the Peninsula in Los Altos, Calif, is one of about 160 Waldorf schools in the country that subscribes to a teaching philosophy that shuns computers and instead focuses on physical activity and learning through creative, hands-on tasks; those who endorse the approach say computers inhibit creative thinking, movement, human interaction and attention spans; school's foothold in tech epicenter Silicon Valley puts into sharp relief intensifying debate about the role of computers in education. (Series: Grading the Digital School)
snippet: The Waldorf School’s computer-free environment has become a draw for parents at high-tech companies like Google.
lead_paragraph: The Waldorf School’s computer-free environment has become a draw for parents at high-tech companies like Google.
